verses.verse: Be not you envious<WH7065> against evil<WH7451> men<WH582>, neither desire to be with them<WH183>.
For their heart<WH3820> studies<WH1897> destruction<WH7701>, and their lips<WH8193> talk<WH1696> of mischief<WH5999>.
Through wisdom<WH2451> is a house<WH1004> built<WH1129>; and by understanding<WH8394> it is established<WH3559>:
And by knowledge<WH1847> shall the chambers<WH2315> be filled<WH4390> with all precious<WH3368> and pleasant<WH5273> riches<WH1952>.
A wise<WH2450> man<WH1397> is strong<WH5797>; Yes<WH376>, a man of knowledge<WH1847> increases<WH553> strength<WH3581>.
For by wise counsel<WH8458> you shall make<WH6213> your war<WH4421>: and in multitude<WH7230> of counselors<WH3289> there is safety<WH8668>.
Wisdom<WH2454> is too high<WH7311> for a fool<WH191>: he opens<WH6605> not his mouth<WH6310> in the gate<WH8179>.
He that devises<WH2803> to do evil<WH7489> shall be called<WH7121> a mischievous<WH4209> person<WH1167>.
The thought<WH2154> of foolishness<WH200> is sin<WH2403>: and the scorner<WH3887> is a abomination<WH8441> to men<WH120>.
If you faint<WH7503> in the day<WH3117> of adversity<WH6869>, your strength<WH3581> is small<WH6862>.
If you forbear<WH2820> to deliver<WH5337> them that are drawn<WH3947> unto death<WH4194>, and those that are ready<WH4131> to be slain<WH2027>;

If you say<WH559>, Behold<WH3045>, we knew it not<WH8505>; does not he that ponders the heart<WH3826> consider<WH995> it<WH5341>? and he that keeps your soul<WH5315>, does not he know<WH3045> it<WH7725>? and shall not he render to every man<WH120> according to his works<WH6467>?
My son<WH1121>, eat<WH398> you honey<WH1706>, because it is good<WH2896>; and the honeycomb<WH5317>, which is sweet<WH4966> to your taste<WH2441>:

So shall the knowledge<WH3045> of wisdom<WH2451> be unto your soul<WH5315>: when you have found<WH4672> it<WH3426>, then there shall be a reward<WH319>, and your expectation<WH8615> shall not be cut off<WH3772>.
Lay not in wait<WH693>, O wicked<WH7563> man<WH5116>, against the living of the righteous<WH6662>; plunder<WH7703> not his resting place<WH7258>:
For a just<WH6662> man falls<WH5307> seven times<WH7651>, and rises up again<WH6965>: but the wicked<WH7563> shall fall<WH3782> into mischief<WH7451>.
Rejoice<WH8055> not when your enemy<WH341> falls<WH5307>, and let not your heart<WH3820> be glad<WH1523> when he stumbles<WH3782>:
Lest the Lord<WH3068> see<WH7200> it<WH7489>, and it displease him<WH7725>, and he turn away his wrath from him<WH639>.
Fret<WH2734> not yourself because of evil<WH7489> men<WH7065>, neither be you envious at the wicked<WH7563>;
For there shall be no reward<WH319> to the evil<WH7451> man<WH5216>; the candle of the wicked<WH7563> shall be put out<WH1846>.
My son<WH1121>, fear<WH3372> you the Lord<WH3068> and the king<WH4428>: and meddle<WH6148> not with them that are given to change<WH8138>:
For their calamity<WH343> shall rise<WH6965> suddenly<WH6597>; and who knows<WH3045> the ruin<WH6365> of them both<WH8147>?
These things also belong to the wise<WH2450>. It is not good<WH2896> to have respect<WH5234> of persons<WH6440> in judgment<WH4941>.
He that says<WH559> unto the wicked<WH7563>, You are righteous<WH6662>; him shall the people<WH5971> curse<WH5344>, nations<WH3816> shall abhor him<WH2194>:
But to them that rebuke<WH3198> him shall be delight<WH5276>, and a good<WH2896> blessing<WH1293> shall come upon them<WH935>.
Every man shall kiss<WH5401> his lips<WH8193> that gives<WH7725> a right<WH5228> answer<WH1697>.
Prepare<WH3559> your work<WH4399> without<WH2351>, and make it fit<WH6257> for yourself in the field<WH7704>; and afterwards<WH310> build<WH1129> your house<WH1004>.
Be not a witness<WH5707> against your neighbor<WH7453> without cause<WH2600>; and deceive<WH6601> not with your lips<WH8193>.
Say<WH559> not<WH6213>, I will do so to him as he has done<WH6213> to me<WH7725>: I will render to the man<WH376> according to his work<WH6467>.
I went<WH5674> by the field<WH7704> of the slothful<WH376>, and by the vineyard<WH3754> of the man<WH120> void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820>;
And<WH5927>, behold, it was all grown over with thorns<WH7063>, and nettles<WH2738> had covered<WH3680> the face<WH6440> there<WH68>, and the stone wall<WH1444> there was broken down<WH2040>.
Then I saw<WH2372>, and considered it well<WH7896>: I looked<WH7200> upon it<WH3947>, and received instruction<WH4148>.
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep<WH8142>, a little<WH4592> slumber<WH8572>, a little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep<WH7901>:
So shall your poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as one that travels<WH1980>; and your want<WH4270> as a armed<WH4043> man<WH376>.
